last block of your last row chain 2 and half_double_crochet twice into the chain-2 space sl st to the next block repeat across row do not create a block on top of your first block of your previous row see the 25 00-minute mark of the tutorial video for more information https //youtu be/qevc1wyr5iw fasten_off and weave in the ends in plain english the wrap is made from two rectangles that are made with mini corner-to-corner stitch c2c it is 30 blocks wide and 36 blocks long each mini c2c block is composed of a chain 2 and 2 half_double_crochet stitches increase at the beginning and end of each row in the mini c2c stitch until you have 30 blocks along each side this means you will create a new block at the start of each row and at the end of the row you will create a block on top of the first block of the previous row then keep one side straight and steady with 30 blocks and increase only on the other side until you reach 36 blocks on the long side then decrease at both the beginning and end of each row until you have only one block remaining this means that at the start of the row you will slip stitch over to the chain-2 space from your last block do not chain 4 and at the end of the row you will not create a block on top of your first block from the previous row pretty peaceful pashmina crochet pattern © 2024 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful join the rectangles with mattress stitch the joining tutorial starts at the 28 00-minute mark https //youtu be/qevc1wyr5iw align one of the short ends of one of the rectangles with a short end on the other rectangle cut a length of yarn twice the length of the seam you are about to sew plus a 6-inch 15 5 cm tail to weave in at each end thread the yarn onto a yarn needle tapestry needle use the mattress stitch to join the rectangles inserting the needle from the back of the work up through one stitch on one rectangle and pull through to the front the photos below show how to join two single_crochet pieces but it s
